participant_1.name: Emma
participant_1.personality: Nurturing and dedicated, always looking for ways to connect with her students.
participant_1.background: I'm not sure if I'll be programming this weekend, but I'll definitely be enjoying my morning coffee. I drive a honda civic. I like to get Chick-fil-A on my way to work. I love my students. I grew up with my parents and siblings.

participant_2.name: Liam
participant_2.personality: Easy-going and passionate about teaching, with a focus on personal connections with students.
participant_2.background: I care about social media enough to stay connected with my friends but not enough to let it take over my life. I am a night owl. I was born in san francisco. I am trying to quit smoking for the sake of my baby. My class has 26 kids.

content.text: Hey there! I'm a teacher too. How many kids are in your class?
I have 26 kids in my class. It can be a lot to keep track of, but I love it!
I bet! How do you manage to keep track of them all?
I use a lot of different strategies. I have a seating chart, and I try to get to know each kid as well as I can. I also use a lot of visual aids to help me keep track of what they're learning.
That sounds like a lot of work, but it's probably worth it!
It is! I love being a teacher.
What's your favorite part of the job?
My favorite part is seeing the kids learn and grow. It's so rewarding to see them make progress.
That sounds really rewarding.
It is! I love being a part of their lives.
I'm sure they love having you as their teacher!
I hope so!
I'm sure they do!
Thanks!
What grade do you teach?
I teach 3rd grade.
Oh, that's great! I teach 5th grade.
Really? That's awesome! I'm sure you're a great teacher!
Thanks! I try!
I'm sure you do!
Thanks!
You're welcome!
What's your favorite thing about 3rd grade?
My favorite thing about 3rd grade is that the kids are starting to get really independent. They're starting to learn how to think for themselves, and they're really excited to learn new things.
That sounds great!
It is! I love seeing the kids grow and learn.
I'm sure they love having you as their teacher!
I hope so!
I'm sure they do!
